revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Brett Gelman | image = Brett Gelman by Gage Skidmore.jpg | alt = Gelman at the San Diego Comic-Con International in July 2011 | caption = Gelman at [[San Diego Comic-Con International|San Diego Comic-Con]], July 2011 | birth_name = Brett Clifford Gelman | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1976|10|6}} | birth_place = [[Highland Park, Illinois|Highland Park]], [[Illinois]], U.S. | education = [[Highland Park High School (Highland Park, Illinois)|Highland Park High School]] | alma_mater = [[University of North Carolina School of the Arts]] | occupation = Actor
Comedian
Producer
Writer | years_active = 2004–present | spouse = {{marriage|[[Janicza Bravo]]|2015}} | website = }} '''Brett Clifford Gelman''' (born October 6, 1976){{cite web|title=Brett C Gelman - United States Public Records|url=https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:KK8Z-DTT|website=[[FamilySearch]]|date=1 December 2005}} is an [[Americans|American]] actor and comedian.{{cite news|last1=St. John|first1=Warren|title=Seinfeld It Ain't|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/01/29/fashion/sundaystyles/seinfeld-it-aint.html|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=29 January 2006}} He is best known for the roles of Brett Mobley in the [[Adult Swim]] comedy-action series ''[[Eagleheart (TV series)|Eagleheart]],'' as Mr. K on the [[NBC]] sitcom ''[[Go On (TV series)|Go On]],'' as Hamish on the [[Comedy Central]] series ''[[Another Period]],'' and as A.J. in the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] comedy series ''[[Married (TV series)|Married]].''{{cite news|last1=Adams|first1=Erik|title=Brett Gelman on playing Go On’s "smoke monster"|url=http://www.avclub.com/article/brett-gelman-on-playing-igo-onis-smoke-monster-84773|work=[[The A.V. Club]]|date=11 September 2012}} He currently co-stars as Martin on the [[BBC Three]] comedy ''[[Fleabag]]'' and has appeared on ''[[Twin Peaks (2017 TV series)|Twin Peaks]],'' [[Making History (TV series)|''Making History'']], and ''[[Stranger Things]].'' == Early life == Gelman was born and raised in [[Highland Park, Illinois|Highland Park]], [[Illinois]].{{cite web|title=Brett Gelman is Here to Change You! • /r/IAmA|url=https://www.reddit.com/r/IAmA/comments/2vsbzp/brett_gelman_is_here_to_change_you/|website=[[Reddit]]|date=13 February 2015}} Gelman's father was a photo salesman. He was raised [[Jewish]] and has a younger sister who is a speech pathologist.{{cite news|last1=Maron|first1=Marc|title=Episode 303 - Brett Gelman|url=http://www.wtfpod.com/podcast/episodes/episode_303_-_brett_gelman?rq=brett%20gelman|work=[[WTF with Marc Maron]]|date=9 August 2012|format=Podcast}} Gelman graduated from [[Highland Park High School (Highland Park, Illinois)|Highland Park High School]].{{cite news|last1=Kharakh|first1=Ben|title=Brett Gelman, Writer, Comedian, and Actor|url=http://gothamist.com/2007/02/20/brett_gelman_wr.php|work=[[Gothamist]]|date=20 February 2007|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160107053258/http://gothamist.com/2007/02/20/brett_gelman_wr.php|archivedate=7 January 2016|df=}} He graduated from the [[University of North Carolina School of the Arts]], where he received classical training in theater. == Career == After college, Gelman moved to [[New York City]] with fellow schoolmate, actor [[Jon Daly]]. While in New York, Gelman was a regular performer at the [[Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre]], as part of the duo Cracked Out, improv group Monkey Dick, and sketch group Mr. A$$.{{cite web|title=Brett Gelman|url=http://www.ucbcomedy.com/user/881|website=[[Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre]]}} A popular [[New York Lottery]] commercial funded his work for a while. Gelman did a one-man show called ''1,000 Cats,'' which he workshopped at many venues.{{cite news|last1=McCarthy|first1=Sean L.|title=Brett Gelman’s "1,000 Cats"|url=http://thecomicscomic.com/2008/03/05/brett-gelmans-1/|work=The Comic's Comic|date=5 March 2008}} Gelman has appeared in the films ''[[The Other Guys]]'' and ''[[30 Minutes or Less]]''. He has co-starred as [[Chris Elliott]]'s sidekick Brett Mobley in the live-action [[Adult Swim]] series ''[[Eagleheart (TV series)|Eagleheart]]'' and is a regular sketch performer on [[HBO]]'s ''[[Funny or Die Presents]]'' and [[Comedy Central]]'s ''[[Nick Swardson's Pretend Time]]''. He has had recurring roles on ''[[The Life & Times of Tim]]'' and ''[[The Inbetweeners (U.S. TV series)|The Inbetweeners]]'', as well as making guest appearances on comedy programs such as ''[[Bored to Death]]'', ''[[Curb Your Enthusiasm]]'', ''[[The Office (U.S. TV series)|The Office]]'', ''[[Happy Endings (TV series)|Happy Endings]]'', ''[[Aqua Teen Hunger Force]]'', and ''[[The League]]''. Gelman has also written for the [[MTV]] sketch series ''[[Human Giant]]'' and the [[Scott Aukerman]] & [[B. J. Porter]] created sketch pilot ''[[Comedy Death-Ray|The Right Now! Show]]''. In 2010, Gelman appeared as a cast member on the [[Comedy Central]] sketch comedy special ''This Show Will Get You High'', created by [[Matt Besser]]. Gelman co-starred as "Mr. K" on the [[NBC]] comedy series ''[[Go On (TV series)|Go On]]'' starring [[Matthew Perry]],{{cite news|last1=Egner|first1=Jeremy|title=J D Souther, Lucy Punch and Others in New Series|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/11/18/arts/television/j-d-souther-lucy-punch-and-others-in-new-series.html|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=14 November 2012}} and as A.J. on the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] comedy series ''[[Married (TV series)|Married]]''.{{Citation needed|date=February 2016}} In 2014, Gelman hosted a dinner party special called ''[[Dinner with Friends with Brett Gelman and Friends]],'' that aired on [[Adult Swim]].{{cite news|last1=Ohanesian|first1=Liz|title=Comedian Brett Gelman Hosts a Dinner Party and It's Really Weird|url=http://www.laweekly.com/arts/comedian-brett-gelman-hosts-a-dinner-party-and-its-really-weird-4597290|work=[[LA Weekly]]|date=23 April 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150315045124/http://www.laweekly.com/arts/comedian-brett-gelman-hosts-a-dinner-party-and-its-really-weird-4597290|archivedate=15 March 2015|df=}} In 2015, Gelman was also a consulting writer on season two of the entertainment news parody series ''[[Hot Package]]'' on [[Adult Swim]] and also recurs as Hamish on the [[Comedy Central]] series ''[[Another Period]]'' and as Ronnie on the [[Starz]] series ''[[Blunt Talk]].'' Also in 2015, Gelman appeared in the last season of ''[[Mad Men]].''{{cite news|last1=Jones|first1=Nate|title=Brett Gelman on Playing a Naked Hippie in the Mad Men Finale|url=http://www.vulture.com/2015/05/brett-gelman-on-the-mad-men-finale.html|work=[[Vulture (blog)|Vulture]]|date=18 May 2015}} In July 2016, Gelman starred in the special ''[[Dinner with Friends with Brett Gelman and Friends#Sequels|Dinner in America with Brett Gelman]],'' a sequel to ''[[Dinner with Friends with Brett Gelman and Friends]],'' which focused on racism.{{cite news|last1=Maron|first1=Marc|title=Episode 719 - John C. Reilly / Brett Gelman|url=http://www.wtfpod.com/podcast/episode-719-john-c-reilly-brett-gelman?rq=brett%20gelman|work=[[WTF with Marc Maron]]|date=27 June 2016|format=Podcast}} In November 2016, Gelman said that he had left [[Adult Swim]] due to the network's alleged poor treatment of female employees and the promotion of controversial ''[[Million Dollar Extreme Presents: World Peace]]''.{{cite news|last1=Strachan|first1=Maxwell|title=Adult Swim Star Severs Ties Over Late-Night Network's 'Misogyny'|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/brett-gelman-adult-swim-cartoon-network_us_5829f49be4b060adb56f6f39|work=[[The Huffington Post]]|date=14 November 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Wright|first1=Megh|title=Brett Gelman Says He’s Severed Ties with Adult Swim Due to Their Treatment of Women|url=http://splitsider.com/2016/11/brett-gelman-says-hes-severed-ties-with-adult-swim-due-to-their-treatment-of-women/|work=Splitsider|date=14 November 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Loftus|first1=Jamie|title=Brett Gelman Doesn't Want Your Praise for Ditching Adult Swim|url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2016/11/brett-gelman-doesnt-want-your-praise-for-ditching.html|work=[[Paste (magazine)|Paste]]|date=15 November 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Roti|first1=Jessi|title=Brett Gelman wants action, not props for his split from 'Adult Swim'|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/chicagoinc/ct-brett-gelman-leaves-adult-swim-wants-action-story.html|work=[[Chicago Tribune]]|date=17 November 2016}} In 2017, Gelman starred in and co-wrote ''[[Lemon (2017 film)|Lemon]]'', opposite [[Judy Greer]], [[Michael Cera]], [[Nia Long]] and [[Gillian Jacobs]], directed by [[Janicza Bravo]].{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2016/film/news/brett-gelman-judy-greer-comedy-lemon-1201838488/|title=Michael Cera, Brett Gelman Starring in Dark Comedy ‘Lemon’|website=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|first=Dave|last=McNary|date=August 17, 2016|accessdate=March 12, 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.screendaily.com/news/us-briefs-burn-later-productions-killer-films-cast-lemon/5108540.article|title=US Briefs: Burn Later Productions, Killer Films cast 'Lemon'|website=[[Screen International]]|first=Jeremy|last=Kay|date=August 17, 2016|accessdate=March 12, 2017}} It had its world premiere at the [[Sundance Film Festival]] on January 22, 2017.{{cite web|url=https://www.sundance.org/blogs/news/competition-and-next-films-announced-for-2017-festival|title=2017 SUNDANCE FILM FESTIVAL: COMPETITION AND NEXT LINEUP ANNOUNCED|website=[[Sundance Film Festival]]|date=November 29, 2016|accessdate=March 12, 2017}} In 2017, it was announced that Gelman was cast in the second season of the hit [[Netflix]] science-fiction web series ''[[Stranger Things]]'' as Murray Bauman, a conspiracy theorist and former journalist. == Other work == Gelman and frequent writing partner and collaborator [[Jon Daly (comedian)|Jon Daly]] performed for many years as the comedy rap duo "Cracked Out".{{cite web|url=http://splitsider.com/2014/04/talking-to-brett-gelman-about-his-new-adult-swim-special/|title=Talking to Brett Gelman About His New Adult Swim Special|last=Evans|first=Bradford|date=April 23, 2014|website=Splitsider.com|accessdate=March 12, 2017}} Gelman has gained recognition for appearing as the "Little Bit Of Luck" character in the "Take 5" [[New York Lottery]] ad campaign that ran from 2008 through 2011.{{cite web|url=http://thecomicscomic.com/2014/09/04/brett-gelman-remembers-his-new-york-lottery-ad-campaign-on-conan/|title=Brett Gelman remembers his New York Lottery Ad Campaign on Conan|website=TheComicsComic.com|first=Sean|last=L. McCarthy|date=April 4, 2014|accessdate=March 12, 2017}} Gelman makes frequent appearances on the ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang!]]'' podcast, as well as other podcasts on the [[Earwolf]] podcasting network. In 2011, he began his own podcast, ''[[Earwolf#Gelmania|Gelmania]]'', also available on the Earwolf network. Gelman has said he wanted his podcast to "reflect a lot of the fears and anger and sadness of the world, but do that through a really stupid lens."{{cite web|last1=Carey|first1=Ross|title=Episode 70: Featuring Brett Gelman|url=http://www.rosscarey.com/2012/10/08/episode-70-featuring-brett-gelman/|website=RossCarey.com|format=Podcast|date=8 October 2012}} In 2014, ''Gelmania'' began its second season but is no longer on the Earwolf network.{{cite web|url=http://gelmaniapodcast.com|title=Gelmania Podcast|accessdate=March 12, 2017}} == Personal life == In December 2015, Gelman married his long-time girlfriend, writer and director [[Janicza Bravo]].{{cite news|last1=Rizov|first1=Vadim|title=25 New Faces of Independent Film: Janicza Bravo|url=https://filmmakermagazine.com/people/janicza-bravo/|work=[[Filmmaker (magazine)|Filmmaker Magazine]]|date=2014}}{{cite web|title=Brett Janicza Wedding Ceremony at Viva Las Vegas Wedding Chapels in The Main Chapel|url=http://websites.vivalasvegasweddings.com/websites/index.php/find-a-wedding/8314?view=website|website=Viva Las Vegas Weddings|date=22 December 2015}} Gelman and Bravo met in New York City while working on a [[New York Lottery|New York Lotto]] commercial. They live in [[Los Angeles]].{{cite news|last1=Gills|first1=Melina|title=Hard World For Small Things Creator Janicza Bravo Tackles Police Brutality Through VR|url=https://tribecafilm.com/stories/interview-janicza-bravo-hard-world-small-things-tribeca-film-festival-virtual-arcade|work=[[Tribeca Film Festival]]|date=23 March 2016}} == Filmography == {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:100%" |- style="text-align:center;" ! colspan=4 style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Film |- style="text-align:center;" ! style="background:#ccc;"| Year ! style="background:#ccc;"| Title ! style="background:#ccc;"| Role ! style="background:#ccc;"| Notes |- | 2004 | ''[[Blackballed: The Bobby Dukes Story]]'' | Mayhem Team Member | |- | 2006 | ''Gingerbreed'' | Driller Driver | |- | 2007 | ''[[Watching the Detectives (film)|Watching the Detectives]]'' | Glenn | |- | 2008 | ''Stick It in Detroit'' | Hot Rod Johnson | |- | 2009 | ''May the Best Man Win'' | Bachelor Party Host | |- | 2010 | ''[[The Other Guys]]'' | Hal | |- | rowspan="3" | 2011 | ''Eat'' | August | Short |- | ''[[30 Minutes or Less]]'' | Pizza Boss | |- | ''[[A Very Harold & Kumar 3D Christmas]]'' | TV Director | |- | rowspan="3" | 2013 | ''[[Jobs (film)|Jobs]]'' | Jeff Raskin | |- | ''[[Awful Nice]]'' | Ivan | |- | ''[[Gregory Go Boom]]'' | Tom | Short, also producer |- | 2014 | ''[[Someone Marry Barry]]'' | Goker | |- | rowspan="2" | 2016 | ''[[Joshy (film)|Joshy]]'' | Greg | |- | ''[[Flock of Dudes]]'' | Howie | |- | rowspan="4" | 2017 | ''[[Lemon (2017 film)|Lemon]]'' | Isaac Lachmann | Also writer |- | ''[[Wilson (2017 film)|Wilson]]'' | Robert | |- | ''DRIB'' | Brady Thompson | |- | ''[[The Disaster Artist (film)|The Disaster Artist]]'' | Acting Teacher | |- | rowspan="2" | 2018 | ''[[Wild Nights with Emily]]'' | Higginson | |- | ''[[Like Father]]'' | Frank Lerue | |} {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:100%" |- style="text-align:center;" ! colspan=4 style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Television |- style="text-align:center;" ! style="background:#ccc;"| Year ! style="background:#ccc;"| Title ! style="background:#ccc;"| Role ! style="background:#ccc;"| Notes |- | rowspan="2" | 2005 | ''Coke'' | Gonzales | TV short |- | ''[[The Colbert Report]]'' | Spencer | Episode: "Greg Behrendt" |- | rowspan="2" | 2007 | ''[[Fat Guy Stuck in Internet]]'' | Co-Worker / Linux / The Oracle | 3 episodes |- | ''Honesty'' | Mechanic | Episode: "Mechanic" |- | 2008 | ''[[Human Giant]]'' | Kidnapped Soldier / Rapzilla / Billy Crystal | 2 episodes |- | 2009 | ''[[Californication (TV series)|Californication]]'' | Annoying Hipster | Episode: "Mia Culpa" |- | rowspan="3"|2010 | ''[[Comedy Lab]]'' | Ruby (voice) | Episode: "Penelope Princess of Pets" |- | ''This Show Will Get You High'' | Cast Member | Comedy Central pilot |- | ''[[Nick Swardson's Pretend Time]]'' | Various | Episode: "Mudslide Junction" |- | rowspan="2" | 2010–2011 | ''[[Funny or Die Presents]]'' | Nick / Performer | 3 episodes |- | ''The Back Room'' | Mr. America / James Gandolfini | 4 episodes |- | 2010–2012 | ''[[The Life & Times of Tim]]'' | Co-Worker / Walker Fan / Adam's Friend / Doug the Intruder (voices) | 4 episodes |- | rowspan="3" | 2011 | ''[[Happy Endings (TV series)|Happy Endings]]'' | Carl | Episode: "Your Couples Friends & Neighbors" |- | ''[[Curb Your Enthusiasm]]'' | Pig Parker | Episode: "Vow of Silence" |- | ''[[Bored to Death]]'' | Faux Jonathan | Episode: "We Could Sing a Duet" |- | 2011–2013 | ''[[The League]]'' | Gavin | 2 episodes |- | 2011–2014 | ''[[Eagleheart (TV series)|Eagleheart]]'' | Brett Mobley | Series regular; 26 episodes |- | rowspan="3" | 2012 | ''[[The Office (U.S. TV series)|The Office]]'' | The Magician | Episode: "[[Welcome Party]]" |- | ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang! (TV series)|Comedy Bang! Bang!]]'' | Dog Lawyer | Episode: "Jon Hamm Wears a Light Blue Shirt & Silver Watch" |- | ''[[Aqua Teen Hunger Force]]'' | Rocket Horse (voice) | Episode: "Rocket Horse & Jet Chicken" |- | 2012–2013 | ''[[Go On (TV series)|Go On]]'' | Mr. K | Series regular; 22 episodes |- | rowspan="3"|2013 | ''[[Ghost Ghirls]]'' | Rabbit | Episode: "I Believe in Mira-ghouls" |- | ''[[NTSF:SD:SUV::]]'' | Gabby Hofstein | Episode: "Unfrozen Agent Man" |- | ''[[We Are Men]]'' | Alimony Steve | Episode: "We Are Franksgiving" |- | 2013–2014 | ''[[Drunk History]]'' | Various | 2 episodes |- | 2013–2015 | ''[[Kroll Show]]'' | Various | 3 episodes |- | rowspan="4"|2014 | ''[[Surviving Jack]]'' | Principal McMullen | Episode: "Rhythm Is a Dancer" |- | ''[[Adventure Time]]'' | Ring Master (voice) | Episode: "Sad Face" |- | ''[[Bad Teacher (TV series)|Bad Teacher]]'' | Doug Pilaf | 5 episodes |- | ''[[Dinner with Friends with Brett Gelman and Friends]]'' | Himself | Special |- | 2014–2015 | ''[[Married (TV series)|Married]]'' | A.J. | Series regular; 23 episodes |- | rowspan="2"|2014–2016 | ''[[Mr. Pickles]]'' | Cheeseman (voice) | 2 episodes |- | ''[[TripTank]]'' | Jeff (voice) | 9 episodes |- | rowspan="6" | 2015 | ''[[Dinner with Friends with Brett Gelman and Friends#Sequel|Dinner with Family with Brett Gelman and Brett Gelman's Family]]'' | Himself | Special |- | ''[[Fresh Off the Boat]]'' | Dusty Nugget | Episode: "Persistent Romeo" |- | ''[[Man Seeking Woman]]'' | Demon | Episode: "Stain" |- | ''[[The Odd Couple (2015 TV series)|The Odd Couple]]'' | Stuart | Episode: "Jealous Island" |- | ''[[Mad Men]]'' | Daniel | Episode: "[[Person to Person (Mad Men)|Person to Person]]" |- | ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang! (TV series)|Comedy Bang! Bang!]]'' | Mr. Celebrity | Episode: "James Marsden Wears Gray Pants and Black High-Top Sneakers" |- | 2015–2016 | ''[[Blunt Talk]]'' | Ronnie | 6 episodes |- | 2015–present | ''[[Another Period]]'' | Hamish | 19 episodes |- | rowspan="5"|2016 | ''[[Angel from Hell]]'' | Lee | Episodes: "Soulmates", "Rain Check" |- | ''[[Clarence (2014 TV series)|Clarence]]'' | Mr. Mozer (voice) | Episode: "Field Trippin'" |- | ''[[Dinner with Friends with Brett Gelman and Friends#Sequels|Dinner in America with Brett Gelman]]'' | Himself | Special |- | ''[[Fleabag]]'' | Martin | Series regular; 4 episodes |- | ''[[High Maintenance]]'' | Himself | Episode: "Selfie" |- | rowspan="2"|2016–2018 | ''[[Love (TV series)|Love]]'' | Dr. Greg Colter | 10 episodes |- | ''[[American Dad!]]'' | Various voices | 4 episodes |- | rowspan="5"|2017 | ''[[Jeff & Some Aliens]]'' | Jeff (voice) | Series regular; 10 episodes |- | ''[[Making History (TV series)|Making History]]'' | [[Paul Revere]] | 2 episodes |- | ''Budding Prospects'' | Vogelsein | Pilot |- | ''[[Twin Peaks (2017 TV series)|Twin Peaks]]'' | Supervisor Burns | 2 episodes |- | ''[[Stranger Things]]'' | Murray Bauman | 4 episodes |- | 2018 | ''[[Camping (U.S. TV series)|Camping]]'' | George | |} == References == {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == * {{IMDb name|1443368}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gelman, Brett}} [[Category:American male comedians]] [[Category:American podcasters]] [[Category:American male television actors]] [[Category:American television writers]] [[Category:Male television writers]] [[Category:American male voice actors]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Highland Park, Illinois]] [[Category:21st-century American male actors]] [[Category:Jewish American comedians]] [[Category:Jewish male comedians]] [[Category:Jewish American male actors]] [[Category:1976 births]] [[Category:Comedians from Illinois]] [[Category:Upright Citizens Brigade Theater performers]]
